application.name: appjit
application.brief: Apply sample/line jitter offsets to the camera pointing of an observation set
application.description:
This program requires an observation set of cubes to be initialized with "spiceinit". It will then apply the offsets in the input jitter table, after high pass filtering them, to the low pass filtered rotations in the InstrumentPointing table of the cubes. The low pass filter is achieved by using a least square solution to compute a polynomial fit of the right ascension, declination, and twist angles of the rotation. This should reduce "noisy" pointing data. To restore the original pointing just rerun "spiceinit".
Note that this program should be used on line scan cameras. It will not work on framing cameras.

history.change: Corrected error handling for master file

parameter.name: FROMLIST
parameter.description: The file specifications for the input cubes all from the same observation. The pointing for these cubes will be updated to correct for jitter and smoothed to remove noise.

parameter.name: MASTER
parameter.brief: Cubes used to initialize pointint fit
parameter.description: The file specification of the cube used to set the apriori pointing fit for all the cubes in the observation FROMLIST.

parameter.name: JITTERFILE
parameter.brief: Ascii table of pixel jitter offsets for selected times
parameter.description: The file specification of the Ascii table of pixel offsets formatted so that each line lists sampleOffset lineOffset ephemerisTimeSeconds

parameter.name: DEGREE
parameter.description: Enter the degree of the polynomial to fit to the data

parameter.name: PITCHRATE
parameter.description: This value can be used to center the adjacent ccd line errors around zero

parameter.name: YAW
parameter.description: This value can be used to center the adjacent ccd sample errors around zero
